info.title: Vector Illustration
info.text: Most digital images (JPGs, GIFs, PNGs) are defined by a grid of pixels. Vector graphics are comprised of paths, which are defined by a start point and an end point, that can be scaled to a larger size without loss of image quality. The red apple is an example of a complex vector illustration, which offers the illusion of a realistic photograph but still retains the freedom to infinitely resize as needed. This piece was created as the accompanying image for a company's popular event series.

info.title: Wireframe Outline
info.text: The wireframe outline is a behind-the-scenes look at the vector paths and advanced three-dimensional modeling used to create the final illustration.
